strategic_benefits.note: Negative exposure = benefit to acquirer. Offsets gross legal exposures in Base Case scenario

LHWCA commercial insurance conversion ($92M NPV Years 2-5, 70% conversion probability)
strategic_benefits.critical_timing_issue: Oakland lease non-renewal deadline possibly December 31, 2025 (passed 10 days ago) - REQUIRES 72-HOUR VERIFICATION

conservative_p20.assumptions: High-probability risks only (>70%), low-end settlement amounts, strategic benefits fully realized
conservative_p20.rationale: Assumes Jones Act cure immediate, LA lawsuit settles low end $125M, ILWU 2-week slowdown only, ship mortgage +50bps, Oakland walk-away executes, LHWCA converts

expected_p50.methodology: Probability-weighted across Base/Downside/Severe scenarios per T7 financial aggregation
expected_p50.rationale: T7 three-scenario modeling: Base Case 60% ($104M benefit) + Downside 30% ($249M) + Severe 10% ($3,050M) = $317.01M weighted
expected_p50.alignment_note: Independently verified, exact match to T7 calculation

maximum_p90.assumptions: Multiple high-severity risks materialize simultaneously but not catastrophic confluence
maximum_p90.rationale: Downside Case scenario: LA lawsuit high end $175M, ILWU 6-week strike $87M, ship mortgage 2/4 lenders force refi $186M NPV, TPSA $100M bond, FMC 12% termination $100M, Oakland delayed 1 year, shore power $252M net

severe_downside_p95.assumptions: Catastrophic confluence: TPSA forced withdrawal + 4-month ILWU strike + ship mortgage cross-default + LA terminal closure
severe_downside_p95.rationale: Severe Downside Case 10% probability: TPSA withdrawal $600M NPV, ILWU 4-month strike + 20% customer attrition $526M, ship mortgage all 4 lenders refuse $587M NPV, LA terminal closure $490M NPV EBITDA loss, strategic benefits eliminated
severe_downside_p95.note: This tail risk drives probability-weighted exposure despite 10% probability

escrow_recommendation.rationale: Tiered structure covers near-term HIGH severity risks (litigation, regulatory, ship mortgage) while allowing phased release as risks resolve

coverage: Jones Act crew remediation cure (R1: $693K weighted)
LA air quality lawsuit settlement (L2: $88M-$123M weighted)
release_conditions: Jones Act cure completed within 90 days
LA lawsuit settled or dismissed with judgment <$140M
No Coast Guard or EPA penalties assessed >$2M

coverage: Ship mortgage lender consent resolution (F1/F2: $38M-$129M weighted)

release_conditions: Ship mortgage lender consent obtained at ≤+100 bps or refinanced
ILWU collective bargaining agreement ratified July 2028 without strike >2 weeks
TPSA members do not invoke Material Adverse Change clause
CII D-rated vessels retrofitted or disposed
Shore power EPA grants secured and construction initiated

test_1_coverage_ratio.interpretation: 63.1% coverage is standard for maritime M&A with strategic benefits offset. Escrow sized to cover Downside Case ($249M) if strategic benefits do not materialize.

test_2_largest_exposure.largest_risk: LA air quality lawsuit settlement (L2: $125M-$175M gross, $105.5M weighted midpoint at 70% probability)
test_2_largest_exposure.note: Escrow $200M exceeds largest single risk $105.5M by 90%

critical_milestones: Jones Act cure: 0-6 months (covered by Tier 1 18-month)
LA lawsuit settlement: 12-24 months (covered by Tier 1 18-month)
Shore power capex: 24-60 months (partially beyond Tier 2)
test_3_time_horizon_match.mismatch_note: Shore power capex extends beyond 36-month escrow, mitigated by R&W insurance $150M environmental coverage and EPA grant certainty (30-40% offset reduces net exposure to $208M-$252M)

escrow_recommendation.recommended_release_schedule: 20% at 12 months ($40M upon Jones Act cure + no Coast Guard audit), 30% at 18 months ($60M upon LA lawsuit settlement), 50% at 36 months ($100M upon ILWU 2028 CBA ratification + TPSA stability)

rw_insurance.scope: Environmental and regulatory exposures only (targeted coverage)
key_exclusions: Known LA lawsuit (pre-existing litigation disclosed in VDR)
Jones Act penalties (regulatory fines excluded from standard R&W policies)
Ship mortgage consent (contractual approval process, not representation breach)
rw_insurance.rationale: Environmental/regulatory category represents $227M-$295M weighted exposure (71.6-93.1% of total). Targeted $150M R&W coverage at 2-3% premium ($3M-$4.5M) is more cost-efficient than broad $300M policy at $10.5M premium per Option B analysis

high_severity_findings.note: Net weighted = $1,030.35M gross weighted - $472M strategic benefits NPV

benefits.title: Oakland terminal walk-away
benefits.critical_issue: Deadline verification required within 72 hours - if December 31, 2025 passed, benefit evaporates

details.title: Ship Mortgage Lender Consent
details.probability: 70-85% conditional approval at +50-100 bps; 20-30% forced refinancing
details.timeline: 30 days to resolution (obtain consent before closing)
details.deal_failure_probability: 5-10% (if all 4 lenders refuse AND refinancing unavailable)
mitigation: Obtain preliminary lender consent within 30 days of Board approval (CRITICAL CLOSING CONDITION)
Accept conditional approval at ≤+100 bps rate increase ($84M-$112M NPV cost)
If >+100 bps demanded, renegotiate purchase price downward by $150M-$200M
Secure backup financing commitment before closing if refinancing required
details.historical_precedent: PE maritime acquisition lender consent rate 75-80% per T2 §IV.D.5

details.title: Oakland Terminal Lease Renewal Deadline
details.deal_failure_probability: 0% (does not block closing, but eliminates 11.5% of deal rationale)
details.strategic_impact: If deadline passed, Base Case benefit drops from $387M to $7M, deal becomes UNECONOMIC at $4.8B purchase price
details.reprice_requirement: $300M-$400M purchase price reduction if deadline passed
mitigation: IMMEDIATE verification within 72 hours: Review Oakland lease §18 termination/renewal provisions
If deadline NOT passed: Deliver non-renewal notice by January 31, 2026 latest
If deadline PASSED: Renegotiate purchase price downward by $300M-$400M OR terminate deal
Alternative: Negotiate 1-year extension with Port at ≤$35M rent, then exit Year 2 (reduces NPV to $367M)
details.recommendation: VERIFY IMMEDIATELY before Board approval. If deadline passed, REPRICE or TERMINATE.

deal_blocking_issues.orchestrator_action: Both issues flagged as CRITICAL CLOSING CONDITIONS. Proceed with V1.2-V1.4 validation, but Board approval contingent on: (1) Ship mortgage lender preliminary consent within 30 days, (2) Oakland lease deadline verification within 72 hours

top_10_exposures.finding: LA/LB air quality lawsuit settlement - partial Clean Air Act preemption defense, City demands $315M shore power capex OR cease operations
Shore power infrastructure LA/LB terminals - California CARB mandate, EPA grants 30-40% offset
ILWU strike/slowdown risk 2027 negotiations - uninsured due to labor exclusion from Loss of Hire coverage
TPSA vessel-sharing agreement withdrawal risk - Material Adverse Change clause triggered by ownership transition
Ship mortgage lender consent - 4 lenders holding $2.8B preferred ship mortgages, 46 U.S.C. § 31321(d) change of control consent required
FMC service contract terminations - 850 confidential service contracts underpin terminal volume, 8% base termination rate
Scrubber installation - strategic choice for 8-12 high-fuel-consumption vessels, alternative to shore power for at-berth emissions
Bunker spill natural resource damages - NOAA assessment for March 2023 Long Beach 18,000 gallon HFO spill (95% recovered)
Offshore wind vessels Jones Act ineligibility - 2 COSCO-built vessels stranded asset, U.S. OCS operations prohibited
CII D-rated vessels retrofit - 2 bulk carriers require corrective action after 3 consecutive D-ratings, IMO MARPOL Annex VI
top_10_exposures.exposure_usd: $1.7M-$4.3M retrofit cost vs $46M-$74M write-down if scrapped

verification_methodology.approach: Independent recalculation from orchestrator-state.md QUANTIFIED_EXPOSURES table (pre-extracted by V1.1), cross-checked against T7 financial-analyst-report.md three-scenario modeling

conflicts.title: Jones Act penalties T1 vs T2
conflicts.resolution: T2 estimate controlling - $693K weighted after immediate cure
conflicts.rationale: Trico Marine precedent establishes judicial discretion, statutory maximum theoretical only

conflicts.title: ILWU strike T3 vs T5
conflicts.rationale: T3 revenue loss + T5 vessel lay-up costs = total exposure

conflicts.title: Oakland terminal T2/T4/T6
conflicts.resolution: No conflict - unanimous recommendation to walk away
conflicts.rationale: All three reports independently conclude walk-away economically superior

conflicts.title: Ship mortgage consent T2 vs T4
Environmental settlements T2 vs T6
conflicts.resolution: No conflict - dual corroboration increases confidence
conflicts.rationale: Both arrived at identical $125M-$175M LA lawsuit and $5M-$8M bunker spill ranges

data_quality_notes: All 7 reports contained quantified exposures with probabilities
T7 financial aggregation performed comprehensive three-scenario modeling
Minor data gap: P&I deductible uncertainty ($500K vs $5M SIR) flagged in T5 §IV.B
verification_methodology.scenario_consistency: T7 Base/Downside/Severe probabilities (60%/30%/10%) applied uniformly across all risk categories
verification_methodology.discount_rate: 8% WACC used for all NPV calculations

time_based_exposure_classification.methodology: Classified each exposure by TIME PROFILE to ensure accurate present-value calculations per agent instruction

examples: Jones Act cure cost $310K (recurring annually but nominal)

MULTI_YEAR.definition: Phased program, defined end, DCF at 8%
examples: Shore power capex $346M-$397M over 24-60 months → $208M-$252M NPV
Ship mortgage rate increase $14M-$28M annual over debt term → $84M-$168M NPV

PERPETUAL.definition: Recurring annually, no end, NPV at 8%
examples: Oakland walk-away $92M-$99M annual → $380M NPV (5-year horizon, conservative)
FMC service contract terminations $240M revenue (baseline, not NPV)
H&M premium increase $1M-$3.75M annual (perpetual fleet insurance)
TPSA withdrawal $378M-$533M annual EBITDA decline (if occurs)
PERPETUAL.note: Strategic benefits (Oakland, LHWCA) use finite horizons (5-year, 4-year) for conservative NPV, not true perpetuities

dcf_quick_reference.note: 8% discount rate applied per T7 methodology

time_based_exposure_classification.default_assumption: ONE_TIME (conservative - does not inflate exposure) if time profile unclear in source reports

correlation_adjustments.methodology: Applied correlation adjustment per agent instruction to avoid double-counting correlated risks
correlation_adjustments.approach: Identified risks with same root cause or domain overlap, applied adjustment factors
correlation_adjustments.rationale: T7 financial aggregation already incorporated correlation adjustments in three-scenario modeling. No additional adjustment required to avoid double-adjustment.

pairs_analyzed.note: HIGH correlation - lawsuit settlement likely dictates shore power timeline and scope. T7 modeled these as linked in Base/Downside/Severe scenarios.
pairs_analyzed.adjustment: Already incorporated in T7 scenario probabilities

pairs_analyzed.note: LOW correlation - wage escalation contractually certain regardless of strike. T7 treated separately.
SAME ROOT CAUSE - P&I deductible applies to Martinez case specifically. T7 modeled as single integrated exposure.
MEDIUM correlation - same regulatory agency (EPA/NOAA), but different incidents. T7 treated as independent.
MEDIUM correlation - lenders may condition consent on Jones Act cure completion per T2 §IV.D.6.
pairs_analyzed.adjustment: T7 Base Case assumes cure before lender decision - correlation addressed in scenario logic

correlation_adjustments.conclusion: T7 three-scenario modeling already incorporated major correlations. Severe Downside (10% probability, $3.05B) explicitly models negative correlation cascade (regulatory failures → ship mortgage refinancing → TPSA withdrawal → ILWU strike impact amplification). No additional statistical adjustment required.
